verb.description: Confirm or settle (a contract or bargain)
Grapple at close quarters, especially (of boxers) so as to be too closely engaged for full-arm blows.
Secure (a nail or rivet) by driving the point sideways when it has penetrated.

noun.description: A struggle or scuffle at close quarters, especially (in boxing) one in which the fighters become too closely engaged for full-arm blows.
A knot used to fasten a rope to a ring or cringle, using a half hitch with the end seized back on its own part.

origin: Late 16th century (in the senses something that grips and fix securely): variant of clench.
